intro: Guettarda uruguensis var. villicalyx, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types. The species is also valued in ecological restoration projects for its ability to thrive in disturbed environments.
